definition: to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
(negative prefix)/not/no
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
surname Wen

sentences.english: But the mother did not seem to hear it.
sentences.chinese: 但作母亲的好象对此听而不闻。

sentences.english: He always turns a deaf ear to other people's criticism.
sentences.chinese: 他对别人对他的批评总是听而不闻。

sentences.english: Their appeals fall on deaf ears and the offensive items are given away.
sentences.chinese: 她们的控诉被听而不闻，这些冒犯的物件被扔掉。
他们视而不见，听而不闻。
她对这句话也听而不闻。

sentences.english: Jawboning from the Japanese government continued overnight although the markets are hardly listening.
sentences.chinese: 日本政府隔夜继续口头干预，但市场几乎听而不闻。

definition: to block one's ears and not listen (idiom); to turn a deaf ear
to turn a blind eye to
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to play deaf-mute
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to set to one side and ignore (idiom); quite indifferent/cold and uncaring
to completely ignore (idiom)/to pay no attention to/not to be in the least concerned about
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to take a laissez-faire attitude
not to pay attention to/to leave sth as it is/to ignore
a matter of no concern to oneself (idiom)
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to be one's old self (idiom)/to be unchanged/(derog.) to be stuck in one's ways
